posts.body:
>>f0efbe66-3b82-4bb7-a151-640c1c30d565
>But I have to wonder, hypothetically if a user is muted, how does one unmute in case of any error?
You can unmute them from ZeroHello(in the hamburger menu).

==To everyone, please read this==
08chan is an really out of date clone of MillChan(http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA). Aside from many missing features and lots of fixed bugs. There also has been a bug in the past that '''didn't delete the files of muted users and continued to share them!''' This has been fixed on millchan, but this __really__ out of date clone probably still has this bug.
Citations:
- [1]: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:b79fce8b-df0d-4ab4-a89e-4c37585aa6d1#post-100b0d69-e615-44a3-ac74-c47448e60a01
- [2]: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:b79fce8b-df0d-4ab4-a89e-4c37585aa6d1#post-fd33330e-6478-411c-8336-e11bafe9cbc4
- [3]: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:b79fce8b-df0d-4ab4-a89e-4c37585aa6d1#post-e4563630-3caf-4cff-8fa3-7575f3b26a16

Aside from many missing features and lots of fixed bugs, there also has been a bug in the past that '''didn't delete the files of muted users and continued to share them!''' This has been fixed on millchan, but this __really__ out of date clone probably still has this bug.
Citations:

posts.body:
08chan is an really out of date clone of MillChan(http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA). Aside from many missing features and lots of fixed bugs, there also has been a bug in the past that '''didn't delete the files of muted users and continued to share them!''' This has been fixed on millchan, but this __really__ out of date clone probably still has this bug.
Citations:
- [1]: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:b79fce8b-df0d-4ab4-a89e-4c37585aa6d1#post-100b0d69-e615-44a3-ac74-c47448e60a01

t. Someone who has been here on zeronet for a while and recently started actually developing things for ZeroNet

>>6f4db937-ddd8-4a82-9412-f0f69c0520e4
t. Not being in jail for 'sharing' kiddie porn.

But jokes aside, this 08chan is terribly out of date. Millchan is the original imageboard.

>Millchan engine
You can even see that it is at the very bottom of this page

In fact this clone is that old that it doesn't even have the right link to the source code anymore.
This is where the source code of millchan is currently hosted, by the way.
https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan

>>5555d160-8ee7-4582-8c80-01b5f8231e02

I have no idea who made 08chan or even if that guy is still around.

But honestly I don't even know why it was necessary to make a clone millchan in the first place.
mcdev has shown time and time again that he will not censor anything, but instead we have mysterious owner of 08chan that no one knows anything about, now

>>d3696f34-7708-4732-ac61-5e1d2c3b2f28
Well it does, if you don't use a fuckall old version of millchan.

>but I'm not really planning to use zeronet in general anyway, I'm just testing out the stuff
Shame it's actually pretty worth while, it's only real issue is a somewhat low number of active users.

>>68e9408a-a714-4946-9ae4-8c8c69b3e635
Don't know if the 08chan owner is even still around, but the original site(millchan) is honestly good enough, I don't know why 08chan needed to be a clone in the first place. Millchan already basically is 8chan in terms of features and is guaranteed to be always up to date, because it's run by the dev of millchan.(don't want to repeat myself too much, see the thread on /b/ for more)

>>d032a845-7ab6-4c60-834c-aac65d06e57f

It looks like more BO/moderation options are in development, though: https://gitgud.io/millchan
Specifically: https://gitgud.io/millchan/merger

>>72a6c15f-72d3-4a9d-931a-d50c38c53fc6
>it might actually be a good idea to have small focused instances.
That what the merger version of millchan is currently in development for.
Source: https://gitgud.io/millchan/merger
Proof of Concept: http://127.0.0.1:43110/17gCoQDCAAoQkzKRiajFNUAhnVD2gSNmuC/

Until that's done you can just mute/blacklist the boards you don't want.
>So this place is going to be a first stop for many anons at least.
That's why I'm being a bit spammy about this. It's a bad impression when people get here and the most crucial feature of a decentral p2p imageboard doesn't do shit.

>>aa2f7ff4-3481-435c-8907-c75ea72e590e
>You meant physically from the hard drive
My mistake, we are in agreement then. 
But anyways, why aren't you using an SSD or FDE **or both**?

>>1f2525a8-54c5-44e3-a8c5-b39f4dd4954d
>I looked over at the merger version and don't see anything on it.
On the merger each board is it's own zeronet site(called hub) and will only appear, if you visited the site of the board at least once.
This is a list of all currently known hubs: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1J1epG5eMc4bsmh69UctBg4PHEe5B3kYHY/hubs.html

>may disrupt the existing community at Millchan
At this point the only really active boards millchan are the cosplay(camwhore, I guess) boards, where people leak patreon content.
Everything else is kind of inactive, due to lack of users. As far as I can tell there is no prejust for anything.

>>c9f3fcec-91aa-4bd2-865d-a193e5e8514a
>Doesn't this also mute the user who made the board?
'Blacklist board' and mute owner are separate options on millchan.
**But 08chan is out of date enough to not even have that feature, yet**

>>1cafffe2-4b32-483d-beea-4245b779218a
Probably what >>b2238be9-852a-4214-a114-160023d37b0b said, but also 08chan was up to date back when it was first cloned. But the owner is either gone, afk or doesn't care enough to keep this site updated. Another thing to note is that millchan is open source, 08chan isn't. The possibility is there, that the owner could've hidden something in here, but no one can really prove or disprove this, because no source is given.

>>843df955-415a-4d2f-b278-c28cbc7eb7db

Keep giving it space, it needs about 100MB in size.

>>f81f3f6f-f980-44c4-941a-cde9c01cc378

>>6f32519c-b12a-4bde-8596-dcef207ffe9b

**Isabelle <3**

>>00236af4-f8e5-4bfe-b8da-fb73a78a3c8d
>Has anyone tried embeds?
Embeds don't work. Mostly restrictions in zeronet, I think.
>Or are we only limited to webms/mp4s?
Basically.

>>cd1cde75-9040-4ed5-85f0-0f6a7a7a0ba1
You don't really have anonymity with a VPN. The VPN provider, by design, __always__ knows who you are and what you done at what time.
You basically trade latency and speed with anonymity when choosing between VPN and Tor.

In general VPN will protect you from copyright-level lawsuits Tor from state level threads, '''IF''' good OPsec is kept.
So whether or not you want to use Tor depends on who you want to be hiding from, but be aware if you used a VPN once it'll be a lot easier to get you if you later switch to Tor.

>>f923f3d0-b843-4a6d-8eb3-62a4217087a9
>>bb5b5907-0fb0-4dc3-95ac-69d9d9068ff9
In terms of number of files there isn't. In terms of file size, I'm not sure maybe around 50MB?

>>704376f2-4eb5-4aee-8037-da4728d7d3f1
Not much, even less here on 08chan.
The problem is that pseudonymous can be generated withing microseconds. ZeroNet at some point introduced proof of work certificates to mitigate this, but no one really seems to use those.

>>8e59eba4-5b46-4296-ac82-9ae2e081b044
IP is irrelevant, only certificate matters, since that is what users can block/blacklist.

>>bbf48f5c-24db-4d4d-a5e3-33ba9746b0ef
>08chan's encrypted addedss:
Never really looked at this but to be real here, to call zeronet addresses encrypted would be like calling a gay man straight: False by definition.

>>2d184682-d09c-497a-9cf6-ef00da22b809
>image taking much much longer to load than usual
Depends on the speed of the attacker, really. Even a 50KB image would do the trick so speed is less of a problem. Mostly that the attacker needs to commit to it and as you said keep his client running 24/7 and even then his post could just be banned(rather blacklisted by default) by the BO.

>>368ae678-01c4-495e-9d08-b64abe1adea5
It does for me. Try reloading.

>>a6533fb2-0fd9-4ff5-8762-97d3bc3275fd

Can confirm that.

Not to sound like a broken record, but
>>48371f78-875f-4e1f-9535-886490de41be
>>4a156bf5-02fd-4321-a0fc-624a9a890165
Millchan has an option to not load thumbnails by default.
>>a22b63b7-2322-42dd-9d58-31d96e987c55
>>89d545f1-bac8-4c32-b19b-e63b59ed3e8f
It's blank because the fingerprint protection in the TorBrowser/firefox(if you activated it there), a but that was fixed ages ago and will work without problems on millchan.

>>b7e2ba38-12c8-4c54-aeae-13ddbcf85bda
>also one poster said this chan has security flaw and we should move to millchan
Thank you!
( See >>3fb6f055-27b3-427c-bfbd-6fa922621219 or http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:b:005bf14e-abc7-4d36-8998-85f086ed7322 )

>>584742e8-46ac-4665-9159-53fc33d219a9
>but are opening the full image save the image in your device?
Yes it will. ZeroNet will save and share the image for as long as no new space is needed. If zeronet runs out of space it will begin to delete the oldest images.
>>c7a01421-26fa-47a2-9447-cb6dc3244b53
>Most likely no. You have to explicitly seed it.
Unfortunately this is false. There is the option to pin a file, which will prevent it from being deleted, if zeronet needs more space.

If you see an image on here that you want to be gone from your hard drive you need to mute that user go to ZeroHello and find and delete the file in the 'files' section.
Millchan would do this all for you, but we are here on 08chan which doesn't do that.

>>8f5e115e-0ef2-434a-9ec6-7f0c87bc5633
>It is good to change things a lot. To prevent fingerprinting
Actually the opposite would be better choose something everyone has and never change it.
This is the reason why it's so recommended to use the Tor Browser, because every Tor Browser looks the same to any fingerprint service. This means you can no longer be distinguished from millions of other users making the gathered data useless. 
You should be aiming to be as same as possible to everyone else, '''not''' as unique as possible.

Everything you do leaks some information, so you want to only leak information that can be gotten anywhere else/is open anyways.

>>483837fe-ac0f-4ae4-b0f4-046786dd08d0
See >>f77d0178-e36c-4713-a8e3-765998337931
TLDR: Don't use an out of date site, go to millchan, the site 08chan was cloned from.

>>227b208e-af10-427d-ad14-86b7b485fd27
>If you make the exception but don't enable Tor on ZeroHello because you followed the instructions, everything you do on ZeroNet is going through the clearnet without using Tor at all.
This is not how it works. Zeronet runs on your computer it doesn't care at all about your browser settings.
The instructions are not **that** inaccurate. Zeronet has three mode in regards to Tor: disabled, enabled and always
'enabled' is the default and will allow connections for bother normal p2p and p2p over onion traffic.
The exception is just so that the domain(likely 127.0.0.1(localhost) for most here) will not be routed throug Tor, since you want to connect to your zeronet client and not some Tor exit node you happen to get out of.
You should use the Tob Browser to prevent the js on sites you  visit to find/leak your IP. Every connection to every peer by ZeroNet couldn't care less about what settings your browser have.
> and it might be suceptible to DDOS too. 
Unlikely, since the availability of BitTorrent mitigates it at the network level. What could happen is that someone spams millchan with computation intensive posts and DOSes the the js that renders millchan/08chan. (There is no server, therefore every processing mist happen in the browser.)
>I don't know if any feature to enable this exists or is coming to Millchan.
The owner of a board can add users to the blacklist by default, effectively banning them. **This is what the 'Enable blacklist'-checkbox at the bottom of the page enables and disables.** That is currently only possible for the owner to do but a full moderation system is currently in development(see the merger thread on millchan /dev/ for more info on that).

>>e542a966-a0f0-4671-82d5-33bab726e8fe
>Incidentally how well does this handle seeding as far as files?
Millchan is a site with about as many peers as ZeroHello itself, so you tell me :^)
**Better than 08chan in any case.**
>Is it based on their hash like 8chan to avoid duplication and such?
Yes, but due to the structure of zeronet dedublication must be dune by the dev of zeronet. Reasons for that are kind of technical, but ask away if you want to know.

>>e88e314b-c411-41ea-8e08-3d25c5a5cae5
I'd stongly advice against it, this place is stupidly out of date and has old, known and already fixed critical bugs still open. See >>f77d0178-e36c-4713-a8e3-765998337931
>>19c4dc06-10ef-4bec-bc88-a2a5ea31a2c1
Depends on whether or not the owner of 08chan is still around, which he doesn't seem to be.
>>c70dcd7a-f7d4-404b-988a-fb7b4abdb883
this.
>>9081df2c-ca18-44c7-9adb-d6078c59a6ee
>Who owns 08chan anyways? Who could do the update to millchan?
No one knows as far as I know.

>>755dc628-9ef2-468e-9d50-ecf245f2a0ab
>>f60c4ff9-2767-458f-893e-27cfc545650f
There are even a fair number of public zeronet proxies out there, btw if you want to show it to a friend:
- https://z.hex3.cf/
- http://zy5ut4vjx2szel76xyjcewqe2y3ezaovsfvzdpskofs4z2gckympdeid.onion

**And more, that I can't be bothered to find right now**

>>22217ba4-04af-49e7-8dcf-c6b094aef120
>So it'll never connect to a Miichan instance without Tor?
No. Millchan get's distributed by the zeronet client.
Zeronet is divided into a onion part(only reachable by using tor) and an clearnet part(reachable without tor).

'Enabled' means that zeronet may choose to use the Tor network to connect to zeronet clients in onion land, but also to zeronet clients in clearnet land. This will generally result in more seeders/peers.
'Always' will only make use of the onion (tor) land of zeronet.**which is practically just as big as the regular one since almost everyone is running the zeronet client in tor:enabled-mode**
In short:
Disabled: clearnet
Enabled: Tor+clearnet
Always: Tor
>>e783507e-d536-4ee3-9ba7-5afc8dbcaed2
>Miichan
It's called millchan, btw.

>>fcf7d5a8-c2d6-42cd-ac19-b63b721596e6
==Do not use zeronets upgrade code feature==
It is __only__ intended for sites that support it, which millchan doesn't! It will likely erase everything.
To update the code clone the millchan repo into a separate directory run and build it with npm, remove everything that is not in the 'data' dir and copy-paste everything that was generated in the dist(I think) file into the site folder then sign and publish. Make a local copy of everything in the sites folder and practice with that first.

>>604a7b34-88a3-4a3e-99cc-e09ce65cb251
>>91e64d97-cf3f-4832-a856-8c5729c9d512
>>d426d4a6-a734-4dfe-b861-f58b3f79333b
That patch ended up not working, also on millchan. One of the devs came to the conclusion that it's impossible to make posts anonymous because ZeroNet itself lacks the ability to do so.
Related issue on gitcenter:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/8@1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC

>>cd511668-3233-4fe9-bbee-e15bdbe72972
>Where is the source code for 08chan?
There isn't any. The link to the bottom refers to an GitCenter mirror of millchans source code.
You are currently on an closed source site


However I what I don't know is why you aren't you on open source and actually up-to-date millchan.
Edit: Also millchan(http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) is run by the actual millchan dev, who has demonstrated for over a year that he will not censor anybody. By contrast 08chan is run by some guy, with maybe some idea on how the source code works.

posts.subject: 08chan vs millchan discussion.
posts.body: Use this thread to discuss whether or not people should move over to millchan or stay here.

>>d71afc02-eef1-41c6-9267-8ebc5353b25c
>Or maybe there's some daemon level option to do it by default?
The fact that it's 2019 and people still don't do FDE aside, you can use veracrypt, make a encrypted file container and tell your zeronet client to put your data folder in there.
>Is SSL used when sharing content in P2P?
Yes, but (like BitTorrent) it's preferred by default, not forced.

>Maybe JS client-side loading would help instead of jumping on a different URL each time with a new running instance.
The url is virtual in a way. Ever 'page' is on one single JS session.
>Why can't switching between boards be faster?
The reason for the bad performance is that you need to validate and process all posts in the browser JS, since there is no server that can do that for you.

>>5d1f3eeb-8f83-4f44-b76b-3e1b869f04a0
Exactly this is already in development by the millchan dev(-s?): https://gitgud.io/millchan/merger
A PoC version is live here: http://127.0.0.1:43110/17gCoQDCAAoQkzKRiajFNUAhnVD2gSNmuC/

>>f0ce8ef1-ddee-417e-8a17-3ddd14cd1cae
See >>95e31583-6b3e-479a-bac4-59f92e7df98c

>>1b86b576-9969-4527-bfdc-690e13a8b3c8
>There is the generation of the thumbnail, but that's not required to either upload the file, OR generate the thumbnail,
What?
>Now explain to me, how does disabling that feature break file upload.
It doesn't. The file upload not working is a bug that has been fixed months ago, which you would know if you'd actually looked at the repo. All this could've been avoided.
It is present here, because 08chan is outdated as shit.
See https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/891120d84b15bf1ba43a8922352d2fffcc4fb36e
or/and https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/1f1a4807cdc3deed34e93e3fa14284df503e229a

>>7a86ea87-19d8-4cd2-8595-247e2e825e49
**In case you didn't already know/see this.**
There already is a merger version millchan. See >>95e31583-6b3e-479a-bac4-59f92e7df98c.

>>63a79187-9cb1-4067-9246-7a3cef2a9b8e
>you can only seed to people who port forward
That's not how it works. If you use Tor you don't actually use any normal connections to peers, but rather use .onion addresses to make connections.
Essentially switching to tor-always mode replaces the ip address with onion addresses, which means that you can now only talk to other onion addresses.

>which I have to because my country will send me to jail for looking at lolicon
My thoughts are with you anon.

>>0044caec-2b99-4e3b-a2de-8e49889428cd

The issue is that co-owners and owners do not differ AT ALL. You become a co owner by getting knowledge of the private key of the site, if you have it there's nothing differentiating you from it's owner.
>But i am nor sure if this site owner is able/willing to allow this or accept devlopment pull requests.
Not sure if you mean 08chan owner or mcdev, but mcdev is said multiple times that PRs are welcome. Talking to him first would probably a good idea, before you go in a totally different direction.
>I think it was said it is not easy to have multiple moderators for the board. maybe it can be developed though?
The millchan guys are already on it:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/?:users/12NPW6WLFBLVivNGqijcfktARobftfLFAN:dev:1b5f282e-6a57-4aa4-ae11-8b85dda51509#post-c244480b-c3b8-4df4-b549-0a4f4d976a9f

**Does anyone actually look at the millchan repo?**
